docs.snippet: GENEVA, April 21. -- Secretary of State Stimson is exercising a calming influence on Europe's troubled waters. This is how he conceives his mission here, and it is in that way he has sought to influence his European colleagues. They have all...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, April 21. -- Secretary of State Stimson is exercising a calming influence on Europe's troubled waters. This is how he conceives his mission here, and it is in that way he has sought to influence his European colleagues. They have all discovered now that he has not brought any panaceas or promises with him.

byline.original: By P. J. PHILIP.Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: ROME, April 29 -- The United States will be represented by five pilots at the congress of transoceanic fliers who linked continent to continent flying over oceans in heavier-than-air machines, which will be opened in Rome on May 22. Colonel Charles...
docs.lead_paragraph: ROME, April 29 -- The United States will be represented by five pilots at the congress of transoceanic fliers who linked continent to continent flying over oceans in heavier-than-air machines, which will be opened in Rome on May 22. Colonel Charles A. Lindbergh, who at first accepted an invitation to be present, has since informed the organizing committee that the kidnapping of his child will prevent his leaving America at present.

headline.main: SEA FLIERS TO HOLD CONGRESS IN ROME; Five Delegates From United States to Enter Session Opening May 22. NINE NATIONS TO TAKE PART Aviators Will Discuss Possibility of Establishment of Regular Transoceanic Air Routes.

byline.original: By ARNALDO CORTESI.Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Large shipments to France and Holland marked the movements of gold through the port of New York in April. France obtained $24,525,200 after having received $37,532,000 in March, while shipments to Holland totaled $22,087,500, against only $14,965,000...
docs.lead_paragraph: Large shipments to France and Holland marked the movements of gold through the port of New York in April. France obtained $24,525,200 after having received $37,532,000 in March, while shipments to Holland totaled $22,087,500, against only $14,965,000 in the first three months of the year.

headline.main: GOLD EXPORTS RISE AS IMPORTS DECLINE; April Movements Here Marked by Large Shipments to France and Holland. LESS EARMARKED METAL San Francisco Received $4,687,000 From Transpacific Points -- El Paso Got $1,000,000 From Mexico.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 30. -- An investigation of the Massie trial in Honolulu should be undertaken by President Hoover, and if he finds the facts identical with those reported in the press he should pardon Lieutenant Massie, Mrs. Fortescue and the two...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 30. -- An investigation of the Massie trial in Honolulu should be undertaken by President Hoover, and if he finds the facts identical with those reported in the press he should pardon Lieutenant Massie, Mrs. Fortescue and the two sailors, Albert O. Jones and E.J. Lord, within a week, Senator James Hamilton Lewis of Illinois said today.
